section.sectiontext: The justifiable rent increase for the purposes of sections 26 and 27 of the Act is the sum of the inflation adjustment factor and the percentage rent adjustments calculated under sections 3 and 4 of this regulation.

part.parttext: Calculation of Justifiable Rent Increase for Single Suites

section.sectiontext: Despite Part 1, the justifiable rent increase for the purposes of sections 26 and 27 of the Act must be calculated according to this Part if the rent increase is for a single suite as defined in this Part.

section.marginalnote: Percentage rent adjustment based on change in local government levies

subsection.subsectiontext: The percentage rent adjustment based on change in local government levies is calculated by using the following formula:

definition.def: means the attributable amount of local government levies less the attributable amount of local government levies for the preceding 12 month period.

subsection.subsectiontext: If a tax, levy or fee that is included in the attributable amount of local government levies or the equivalent for the preceding 12 months is one that is incurred at less than annual intervals, that tax, levy or fee must be represented on an annual basis when calculating change in local government levies under subsection (1).

section.sectiontext: The percentage rent adjustment based on capital expenditures is calculated by using the following formula:

section.sectiontext: The justifiable rent increase for the purposes of sections 26 and 27 of the Act is the sum of the inflation adjustment factor and the percentage rent adjustments calculated under sections 8 and 9 of this regulation.
